intro: Vittadinia nullarborensis, commonly known as the Nullarbor daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a compact cluster, often surrounded by narrow, grass-like leaves. It is well adapted to harsh, dry environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. Vittadinia nullarborensis is an important component of the flora in the Nullarbor Plain and surrounding areas.
